mizzle verb [I]
(RAIN)
to rain with many very small drops: It's been mizzling most of the morning. Because it began to mizzle, he darted away and borrowed two umbrellas for us. See also
drizzle verb (RAIN)
More examplesFewer examplesIt was mizzling steadily, so I bought a minibus ticket, which cost more than a taxi would here.By the time I was down in the valley it was cool and mizzling.It was mizzling a bit but my two children were playing outside.

mizzle verb [I]
(DISAPPEAR)
UK old-fashioned informal to disappear quickly and suddenly: She mizzled into the crowd. The gentleman who employed me has mizzled, and he owes me fifty pounds.
